uniol.apt.analysis.coverability

Class CoverabilityGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • uniol.apt.analysis.coverability.CoverabilityGraph

  • public class CoverabilityGraph
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a coverability graph of a Petri net. Let's first define the reachability graph: The reachable markings of a Petri net form a graph. The arcs between markings each belong to a transition which is fired for getting from one transition to another. This graph may be infinitely large. The coverability graph is based on the reachability graph. However, the markings used may contain OMEGAs which means that a place can have infinitely many tokens. This extension makes the coverability graph always bounded.
    Author:
    Uli Schlachter, vsp

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public static CoverabilityGraph get(PetriNet pn)
        Construct the coverability graph for a given Petri net. If a coverability graph for this Petri net is already known, that instance is re-used instead of creating a new one.
        Parameters:
        pn - The Petri net whose coverability graph is wanted.
        Returns:
        A coverability graph.

      • getReachabilityGraph

        public static CoverabilityGraph getReachabilityGraph(PetriNet pn)
        Construct the reachability graph for a given Petri net. If a reachability graph for this Petri net is already known, that instance is re-used instead of creating a new one. Keep in mind that the reachability graph of a Petri net can be infinite!
        Parameters:
        pn - The Petri net whose coverability graph is wanted.
        Returns:
        A coverability graph.

      • toReachabilityLTS

        public TransitionSystem toReachabilityLTS()
                                   throws UnboundedException
        Turn this coverability graph into a labeled transition system.
        Returns:
        The new transition system.
        Throws:
        UnboundedException - This exception is thrown when the Petri net is unbounded.
        See Also:
        For a version of this which does not reject unbounded nets.
